intro: Cyrtandra yaeyamae, commonly known as Yaeyama Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Yaeyama Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant is shrub-like, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
